Decreased hemoglobin for autoimmune hemolytic anemia can be managed with a course of corticosteroids and it is not an indication for anti-CLL treatment. Corticosteroids have the largest evidence of activity in CLL-related autoimmune hemolytic anemia and are the guidelines-recommended first line treatment.
34 It is not known whether corticosteroids increases the risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection or mitigates its severity.
